definition: the process of removing salt from seawater
a large area of land that has very little water and very few plants growing on it. Many deserts are covered by sand.
the process of becoming or making something a desert
the process of discovering or noticing something, especially something that is not easy to see, hear, etc.; the fact of being discovered or noticed
a piece of equipment for discovering the presence of something, such as metal, smoke, explosives or changes in pressure or temperature
a liquid or powder that helps remove dirt, for example from clothes or dishes
something that makes somebody less likely to do something (= that deters them)
treatment given to people to help them stop drinking alcohol or taking drugs
the process of improving the reputation of somebody/something that has been seen as morally bad
the process of removing harmful substances or poisons from something
a process for separating substances from a liquid, especially for taking waste substances out of the blood of people with damaged kidneys
a book or electronic resource that gives a list of the words of a language in alphabetical order and explains what they mean, or gives a word for them in a foreign language
a book that explains the words that are used in a particular subject
a list of words in electronic form, for example stored in a computer’s spellchecker
the act of recognizing or showing that two things are not the same
treatment of people or things in different ways, especially unfairly
the process of a cell becoming different during growth and development
the act of spreading something widely in all directions; the fact of being spread in all directions
the act of slowly mixing a gas or liquid in a substance; the process in which this happens
the act of making a light shine less brightly by spreading it in many directions
a chemical (with a ring structure containing two oxygen atoms) that is formed as a result of some industrial processes. Dioxins are toxic (= poisonous) and cause harm to the environment.
an official instruction
an unexpected event, such as a very bad accident, a flood or a fire, that kills a lot of people or causes a lot of damage
a very bad situation that causes problems
a complete failure
a thing or person that is very likely to cause danger or a problem in the future because of the condition it is in or the way they behave
an illness affecting humans, animals or plants, often caused by infection
something that is very wrong with people’s attitudes, way of life or with society
a substance that kills bacteria, used for cleaning
the act of cleaning something using a substance that kills bacteria
the act of running a computer program to get rid of a computer virus
the process by which people or things are spread over a wide area
the act of officially ending a marriage, a business agreement or a parliament; the act of breaking up an organization, etc.
the process in which something gradually disappears
the process of distilling a liquid; the process of making strong alcoholic drink in this way
the process or result of getting the essential meaning, ideas or information from something
the way that something is spread or exists over a particular area or among a particular group of people
the act of giving or sharing something out among a number of people
the system of transporting and delivering a product
a long channel dug at the side of a field or road, to hold or take away water
an official paper, book or electronic file that gives information about something, or that can be used as evidence or proof of something
a computer file that contains text that has a name that identifies it
the documents that are required for something, or that give evidence or proof of something
written instructions for using a product, especially a computer program or equipment
the act of recording something in a document; the state of being recorded in a document
an animal with four legs and a tail, often kept as a pet or trained for work, for example hunting or guarding buildings. There are many types of dog, some of which are wild.
a male dog, fox, wolf or otter
greyhound racing
a thing of low quality; a failure
an offensive way of describing a woman who is not considered attractive
used, especially after an adjective, to describe a man who has done something bad
to be raining heavily
an event that is planned only in order to impress people so that they will support or buy something
a situation in business, politics, etc. where there is a lot of competition and people are willing to harm each other in order to succeed
a person who stops other people from enjoying something that the person cannot use or does not want themselves
a thing that has been done badly
an unhappy life, full of problems or unfair treatment
everyone has good luck or success at some point in their life
when a person already has a bad reputation, it is difficult to change it because others will continue to blame or suspect them
to get into a very bad state
alcohol that you drink in order to make you feel better when you have drunk too much alcohol the night before
to be involved in a situation so that you will gain or lose according to the result
to avoid mentioning a subject or something that happened in the past, in order to avoid any problems or arguments
extremely hard
in a very bad or cruel way
very determined and refusing to give up
to have no chance at all
feeling very sick; vomiting a lot
used to describe a situation in which the most important aspect is being influenced and controlled by somebody/something that is not as important
(you cannot) successfully make people change their ideas, methods of work, etc., when they have had them for a long time
to allow somebody to suffer or be punished in an unfair way, as if they have no value
if somebody can do a task for you, there is no point in doing it yourself
the amount of a medicine or drug that is taken regularly, and how often it is taken
an amount of a medicine or a drug that is taken once, or regularly over a period of time
an amount of something
very fast and easily
the same bad treatment that you have given to others
an insect with a long, thin body, often brightly coloured, and two pairs of large transparent wings. Dragonflies are often seen over water.
the process by which water or liquid waste is drained from an area
a system of drains
a long period of time when there is little or no rain
a long period of time when there is a lack of something that is needed or wanted
a small hill of sand formed by the wind, near the sea or in a desert
a fine powder that consists of very small pieces of sand, earth, etc.
the fine powder of dirt that forms in buildings, on furniture, floors, etc.
a fine powder that consists of very small pieces of a particular substance
to fail, or to be defeated or destroyed
to die
to not be used for a long time
to leave somebody far behind
to wait for a situation to become clear or certain
a house, flat, etc. where a person lives
to change the colour of something, especially by using a special liquid or substance
a long thick wall that is built to stop water flooding onto a low area of land, especially from the sea
a channel that carries water away from the land
an offensive word for a lesbian
a sudden, violent shaking of the earth’s surface
a common long thin worm that lives in soil
a small brown insect with a long body and two curved pointed parts called pincers that stick out at the back end of its body
